Posts.Content: Gkeller689 wrote: Hello everyone. I am new to this site, please forgive me if I don't have the proper etiquette or terminology! I found a very tiny bump above my nipple after experiencing a sharp stinging pain in my left breast. I had noticed this 2 months prior and had it checked by my ob/gyn. She advised it could be hormonal and to wait till after my period. While waiting for my period to come and go I noticed a green discharge only when I squeeze that nipple. The tiny bump did not go away so I followed up with an u/s. the tech said she didn't find anything, not even a cyst. Is it normal to have discharge from one breast? It only appears when I squeeze the actual nipple, but I also have terrible stinging pain in this nipple. Should I call the dr. again? I feel silly that I didn't mention the discharge before, but I wasn't really squeezing my breast before I found the lump either! Please help, I need advice! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Normal U/S, green discharge Gkeller689 Gkeller689

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2013 10:16AM Gkeller689 wrote: Thanks EmD, I saw my dr and she referred me to a breast specialist, we're assuming its duct ectasia. I just have a gut feeling that's not it. We'll wait and see. Thanks again!
Posts.Title: Normal U/S, green discharge Gkeller689 Gkeller689

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2013 06:19PM Gkeller689 wrote: Hi EmD, I just read the entire thread. I can completely identify with over analyzing and feeling neurotic! I thought I had an indent this morning. There is about a 1/4" divet directly under my nipple, which coincidently is the same one that has discharge and the same breast that I felt a lump in. I have seen the blue vein many times on myself, but I think it comes and goes every month with my cycle. I don't know what to think anymore. Every little thing I see screams "cancer" to me. I just want to say hang in there. Don't feel like you can't express your rants and fears here, because I feel the same and it comforts me to know that it's common among those waiting for a diagnosis. Keep your head up! Best wishes!!
Posts.Title: Indent or no indent, that is the question. EmD EmD

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2013 08:45PM Gkeller689 wrote: Hi mishat, mine biopsy is Monday. I know how you feel, it's extremely frustrating to wait and not know. Good luck tomorrow, I'm sure you are in good hands. Please let us know how it went, I'm very curious to know what it's like. Maybe you could help calm my fears too.
Posts.Title: Who's Getting a Biopsy Tomorrow? MishaT Southernangel
